phrases: Mashiro!
So Miho's having her debut as a seiyuu, huh?!
It is still just a small part.
He is just being shy.
But it is amazing, is not it?
Now, if you and Takagi make an anime,
then you can use Miho for the heroine and get married, right?!
It is almost scary!
I am so excited!
You cannot get an anime adaptation that easily.
And I do not think Azuki will be able to play the part...
if she does not get into the position where she can be a heroine.
Why is he being so cool and collected about this?
He is that kind of character.
Anyway, how about the three of us watch it together when it airs?
It is late at night, is not it?
It is all right.
I will just tell my parents I am watching it with some friends since Miho's in it.
With guy friends?
Well, I will not tell them that much.
Sorry, I would rather watch it alone.
RReally?
Sorry.
Well, we are heading to the workplace, so...
Okay...
Hey, is it okay if I watch it with you?
Eh?
Sei Visual.
Azuki becoming a seiyuu...
and our dream of getting an anime involve me too, do not they?
Mm, I guess they do.
So, you want to watch it together at the workplace?
Yeah, sorry.
I really want to get an anime before Azuki becomes the heroine for another anime...
I feel the same way.
Azuki's been our heroine ever since middle school.
Our?
Eh?
Is that going too far?
Then she is your heroine.
And my heroine's... Miyoshi?
You upset about that?
No, I am totally fine with it.
A heroine, someone who would be liked by everyone...
I do not think this way is right.
Dammit!
Since Futatsu no Chikyuu and Kane to Chie both had dramatic tones to them,
I cannot draw a cute girl!
Cannot you just do it like that one?
You know, like when you drew Azuki in your notebook during the third year of middle school?
NNo good?
I am just saying, that was not a dramatic kind of thing, it was super cute.
You are right, I have heard of a bunch of times where mangakas drew their own ideal girl as the heroine.
Whoa, awesome!
I can draw cute really easily!
Okay, then here.
If there are not any problems with them, make a copy.
TL Note: Watashi no Angel = My Angel
An angel for a protagonist, huh?
Pirates, ninjas, shinigami, youkai...
Those sort of things are done all the time,
but I have never seen something in Jack with an angel for a protagonist.
And if you make it a cool-looking angel, it will be popular with girls too.
Hanasaka Tenshi Tenten-kun had one, though.
Yeah... but that was a gag manga.
I really liked it as a kid.
Which means this could be popular with kids.
Yeah.
Well, if you look for manga with angels as protagonists, you could probably find a bunch.
Okay, okay.
If you are afraid it overlaps with one too much, then I will not draw any more.
You have an angel suddenly killing someone, though.
That is a bad angel.
The angels' mission is to deliver dead humans to heaven.
But there are some angels that come down to earth in swarms to deceive and kill humans,
in order to earn more points.
In order to stop them, the angel of justice swoops down to the human world!
He falls in love with a girl and they fight the evil angels.
And the end will be emotionally moving!
I am confident about this.
Yeah, it is interesting.
This really fulfills the conditions Hattori-san gave us.
It is Hattori-san.
Hello, it is Takagi.
I know this is sudden, but do you know about the Gold Future Cup?
Ah, yeah.
They held it last year too, did not they?
That one where newcomers compete with one-shots?
Well, they have it this year too.
Do you want to try submitting a name...
in order to gain some achievements before the next issue of NEXT!
Really?
The Gold Future Cup?
We will do it.
We are drawing a good one right now.
Only four or five works are actually run,
but I think about twenty names get sent around.
However, the deadline is June 25th, so there is not much time
We will be fine!
We will have it done with time to spare!
This is a great chance!
Yeah!
If we get first in the Gold Future,
serialization will not be just a dream anymore!
We will definitely make it happen!
It will be fine, even if it needs fixes.
Let us bring in the name three days before the deadline.
Okay!
For the angel protagonist, I do not think he should have clothes exactly like a human's.
Oh, you are right.
The readers need to be able to differentiate between angels and humans.
Takagi!
Mashiro!
I got some tickets to a movie!
How about the three of us go after school?
Sorry, we have got to finish a manuscript in a hurry.
What should we do?
You always have them with wings in this name.
Well, I guess they can show them to the humans that find out they are angels,
but typically they should hide them.
Oh, yeah.
She has lessons today.
Why does everybody else have a dream?
I want a dream too!
Incredible.
You have got everything I said was necessary for a battle manga in here.
And it feels natural.
You are even more skilled than I thought, Takagi-kun.
Honestly, I did not think you would be able to get this far drawing battle manga.
Sorry.
Ah, no problem.
But...
I am extremely limited in the advice I can give as an editor.
It is very important for mangakas to be able to do more than what their editors tell them.
Understand?
Ah, yes.
I think so.
Editors cannot make stories that they can be sure will sell.
And though this sounds extreme, if we could, we would just draw them ourselves!
A mangaka has to surpass his editor!
UUm, are you saying that this name is not any good after all?
Ah...
Sorry, that is not what I meant.
I am saying that what you have at this point is good, but...
I do not want you to just aim higher,
I would also like you to do something that would surprise me.
The same with Mashiro-kun's drawings.
These drawings are very high quality.
They pass.
But as for something that surpasses my advice...
If you came up with something people could not ask for,
that no one could imitate, it would be perfect.
Well, maybe I am setting the bar too high, but please think of it as a compliment that I am asking this much of you.
All right.
Anyhow, I will send this in for Golden Future.
I was really surprised that Hattori-san said we could draw mainstream.
It is got me pretty fired up.
Feels like we can do it, does not it?
Really?
I feel like we were taken in a little.
He said it was good, but that it did not really shine.
Shine?
He said he would submit it for Golden Future,
but it sounds like you have to do something that really shocks the editor to be number one.
A long time ago, my uncle said the same thing.
There are lots of people that can win awards and debut.
The real problem comes after that.
Those that can make it to serialization are only one out of a few dozen.
It is already hard to be happy about having an entry.
I want to be number one and get serialized...
Popular... Popular...
I want to be popular!
YYou're embarrassing me, stop it!
Thanks for coming all the way here.
Huh?
Where is Shimoyama-kun?
Ah, he quit.
He quit?!
Um, the drawings are going fine,
but under these conditions, I would appreciate another assistant or two.
Okay, got it.
Niizuma-kun, I am here to pick up the manuscript.
Oh, you are here.
How is Ashirogi-sensei doing?
Eh?
Uh, I think they submitted something for the Golden Future Cup.
Oh, that one where they compete?
Yes.
They will have a one-shot running, I am looking forward to it.
Ashirogi-sensei will be number one.
Yes!
Crow!
What?
It is not even being entered?
Yes.
It is unfortunate, but that is the feedback I got.
Also...
Not only is it not going to be in Golden Future,
but as it stands, even if it were sent in for the summer NEXT!,
they said it probably would not do well there either.
Maybe mainstream is impossible for us after all.
I am the one who said we had to do mainstream.
I cannot make stories like you, Shuujin.
We should just do the stories you want to
Do not say stuff like that!
I said I wanted to aim for the top by doing mainstream too!
To get a call like this, today of all days...
We will not be able to enjoy Azuki's appearance in the anime.
WhWhat's going on?
Even though I am so depressed, I am actually getting really excited!
Sei Visual Gakuin Koutou Bu!
It is starting!
We...
We are saints!
A new excitement is awakening in my heart.
If we have a rendezvous, then yes,
your heart is...
Well then, everyone, take care.
Hey, it is almost over already?
Is Azuki really in this?
UUm, senpai..
There she is!
Saotomeji Reika!
Ever since...
I came to this school, senpai...
II've liked you, Elina-senpai.
All the new students say that to me.
Likes her?
What is this?
What is with this charge between them?
Shut up, Shuujin!
Ah, ssorry.
Take care.
So in the end, Azuki only had four lines.
But she was a lot better than I would expected.
Azuki...
This is the actress who plays Ijyuuniin Elina, Ootsukina Nanami.
It is Azuki!
Aw man, they are showing her on-screen!
I wonder if she is embarrassed.
Being shown on TV in cosplay.
No, Azuki's the same as us.
She is determined to move forward.
We cannot lose.
Azuki's going to keep doing her best from here!
We cannot get depressed over something like being rejected!
YYeah.
You are right.
Tsuda.
Here.
Segawa.
Here.
Takagi.
Is Takagi absent?
Takahashi.
Here.
Nice weather, is not it?
Your cell phone's ringing.
Hattori-san?
Hearing you were rejected must have been a shock, huh?
No...
Yes.
Yes.
You must feel frustrated.
Yes.
That is good.
Your name is in this envelope.
Though the candidates for the Golden Future Cup got sent around to the higher ups,
the people on this read it and wrote their critiques of it.
Give it a read.
ThThat's it.
I cannot read anymore...
Shuujin...
Hattori-san, you did not write these yourself, did you?
I would not do something like that.
I really did not think the editorial department was expecting so much from us,
saying we show promise and everything.
Yeah, I was surprised too.
Though it actually made me feel pressured to write a good piece next time.
But that Miyoshi sure is amazing.
Mm.
Yesterday when I got home, I checked how many newcomers were closer to serialization than us,
and there were at least fifteen.
I see.
No matter how much they expect of us, all we have done is run in NEXT!
once.
I guess we have got some hard work ahead.
He said your drawings were high quality,
so I guess now...
I need to focus on my name.
Fifteen to two.
Group three wins!
Phew, it is finally over.
What?
What about what?
You were watching me the whole time, were not you?
Yeah, I saw your tits bouncing all over the place.
Again with that total pervert stuff?!
It was a joke...
Look, see?
It is true, she is in here!
Anticipated beautiful girls of the seiyuu world?
She is on the business office's homepage too.
Miho's school does not allow part time-jobs,
so she got in trouble over it.
I got an email from her saying, Since I have been such a diligent student, they let me off the hook!
Yeah.
Apparently they said they will cooperate as long as she puts her schoolwork first.
It must be nice to be serious and cute.
Miyoshi, did you come here just to show us this?
I have an announcement.
Announcement?
Thanks to you, I too have chosen a dream.
Dream?
What?
I am going to be a writer.
Writer?!
Miho is a seiyuu...
Takagi and Mashiro are mangakas...
I figured that I want to stand on the same level as all of you, so I chose writing.
What a shallow thought process...
But I think I will do cell phone novels.
Lots of companies are taking them on the Internet.
What are you going to write?
A romance.
Modeled after Miho and Mashiro.
Of course, I am going to change it from mangaka and seiyuu.
I will make it a novelist and an actress.
I think I will change the anime adaptation and heroine parts
to a live-action drama adaptation and lead actress.
That could be interesting!
I know, right?
What the hell are they doing?
So Takagi, could you help me out a little with it?
In exchange, I will help you write girls' emotions for your manga.
Hm...
Well, for what I am writing now, I will be needing a heroine...
Yay!
Then it is settled!
I understand your desire to have a dream too, Miyoshi,
but honestly I do not want you interfering with our manga.
Eh, why?!
You are going to need girl's emotions too, are not you?
It is shounen manga, we can just make it a boy's idealized version of a girl.
Ah, right.
But Takagi is the one coming up with the story.
Hey, I have got some of my writing stored on my cell phone.
Could you take a look at it?
Shuujin.
These plans are all by the book, none of them are original.
They are not boring, but they feel the same as Angel Days that we submitted for the Golden Future Cup.
Unless we come up with something that will stand out, I think we will just get the same result.
I see...
It is true that all mainstream stories I write feel similar.
Maybe I have been too focused on what Hattori-san told us.
Perhaps I will try to work on it a little more.
Hey, Saikou.
I do not think I can keep doing this the same way.
You cannot?
It is like I am forcing myself to think up plans every day.
In order to force things to move when they will not,
I keep thinking of original setups to the stories.
But I really do not think that will do it.
Unless I can come up with characters that make me say This is it!, then it is not good enough.
Like Eiji said, characters that move by themselves, and that you want to see move.
If that comes to me, I think I will be able to write something different than what we have done up until now,
something that really stands out.
And though I do not know how to get that yet, I will use my whole summer vacation.
I will try to come up with it alone, with a little change of pace.
I see.
Got it.
Somehow, I...
No, sometime during summer vacation, I will write an interesting name.
Eh?
A work from Mashiro-kun?
Yeah.
For the work that won the second place prize in the name category for the last Story King.
Mashiro-kun's artwork is pretty good for a newcomer.
No good?
Please do not say something so ridiculous.
Of course he cannot.
Ashirogi Muto is a two-man team.
Yeah, you are right...
I guess I will ask elsewhere.
Sorry.
Then what about Mashiro-kun working as an assistant?
Assistant?
You are not talking about Niizuma-kun, are you?
Yeah.
The mangaka is sixteen, so the older assistants are giving him the cold shoulder.
Mashiro-kun is younger than him and he is a good artist.
Even just for summer vacation would be fine.
Ashirogi Muto thinks of Niizuma-kun as a rival.
There is no way he will go for it.
Cannot you just ask, please?
At times like this, as fellow editors, we should help each other out.
Only if both Takagi-kun and Mashiro-kun agree to it.
I do not think they will though.
Takagi!
I am so happy.
This is the first time you have invited me on a date, is not it?
So, what do you want to do?
A movie, karaoke, bowling?
Bowling!
Shuujin did not come today either.
He has not contacted me once since summer vacation started.
I guess mainstream really is difficult.
That was fun!
You got over two hundred, that is incredible!
Well, you managed to get a hundred yourself did not you?
I was not really trying.
I want to do karaoke next.
Okay.
Yay!
Oh, sorry, my phone's ringing.
Yes?
It is Hattori.
Is the name coming along?
Yes, well, uh...
I am writing some, but I have not been coming up with anything that Mashiro is happy with.
I see.
Actually, I am calling to ask if Mashiro could work as an assistant.
Assistant?
For something like this, I figured I should ask you first before asking Mashiro-kun.
I see.
Um...
The truth is, I am sort of struggling right now.
I cannot think of anything that is really it.
So, I have been keeping Mashiro waiting the whole time.
And I really do not have any excuse.
That is why if Mashiro says he will go, I will not stop him.
I understand.
Huh?
Me, be an assistant?
Yes, it is fine if it is just for summer vacation.
But right now, we are trying to get serialized...
Takagi-kun was against it, but he said if you wanted to go, he would not stop you.
Takagi said that?
Yes.
And if you want to go, it is for Niizuma-kun.
Niizuma Eiji...
Until we get serialized, please continue being serialized and wait for us.
Roger.
But I may be number one by then.
Of course, you are not obligated to do it.
I am personally reluctant about it,
but I thought I would ask, just in case.
I understand, I will do it!
Mashiro would be an assistant?
Yeah, he would be helping out another mangaka.
Even though you two make up Ashirogi Muto?
It is my fault for keeping him waiting.
Even though I am the one who invited him to become a mangaka in the first place.
So, let us go home.
Takagi...
I am not... getting in the way, am I?
If I go to Eiji's place, I might pick up something.
It is for Shuujin's sake too, since he is struggling with the name!
This is the actress who plays Ijyuuniin Elina, Ootsuki Nanami.
I play the role of Saotomeji Reika, my name is Azuki Miho.
Now then, on the next Sei Visua
That is not right!
Nanami-san...
Next time, Goblin and Kindness.
If a dream is conceited it will not come true!
